instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage. No light on MG, no fan spin, all coils 0V
threads.message:
Hi there,

no water damage. No light on MG (1 out of 10 i get orange light that fades out), no fan spin, all coils 0V. Tested with good working io board and cable.
Please advice how to proceed.

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage. No light on MG, no fan spin, all coils 0V
threads.message:
Post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.
If no voltage, post diode mode too.

Keep connected only DC cable, leave out LIO flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage. No light on MG, no fan spin, all coils 0V
threads.message:
No voltage on both <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>. without LIO flex only with DC cable.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 137 in diode mode
<SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 328 in diode mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage. No light on MG, no fan spin, all coils 0V
threads.message:
Now post <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>.
If no voltage, post exact <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> value; measured onboard, ohm scale.
Check if <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> is not open, or shorted.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage. No light on MG, no fan spin, all coils 0V
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> at J7000 - jumping between 16.51 - 16.68V
<RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> measured onboard - 56.2k
<DIODE>D7012</DIODE> - not open. Tested in continuity mode between <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> pin 2 to <RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR> pin 2.
BUT with my sharp eagle eye I saw that pin 2 of <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> had the smallest oxidation I have ever seen. Replaced it and machine works again.
Thanks for your help!
